After you select an appropriate protocol, adopt that protocol. The compiler may ask you to reimplement some of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s accessor or action methods. Simply implement these methods, and your control is ready to use.

# Custom Controls

**API Collection**

Support accessibility for custom user interface elements by adopting a role-specific protocol and implementing its methods.

## Overview

Role-specific accessibility protocols represent the most common control types found in apps. Adopt a role-specific accessibility protocol if:

- You’re creating a custom control that’s a subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView], and you want to modify the control’s behavior beyond what AppKit provides by default.
- You’re working with a specialized control that doesn’t subclass [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView]. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityElement-swift.class] first.

First, identify the role-specific protocol that best matches your control’s intended behavior. For example, if your control is something that triggers actions when the user clicks it, adopt the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityButton] protocol.

After you select an appropriate protocol, adopt that protocol. The compiler may ask you to reimplement some of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s accessor or action methods. Simply implement these methods, and your control is ready to use.

## Buttons

- **NSAccessibilityButton**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a button.
- **NSAccessibilityRadioButton**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a radio button.
- **NSAccessibilitySwitch**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a switch.
- **NSAccessibilityCheckBox**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a checkbox.

## Value Controls

- **NSAccessibilityStepper**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a stepper.
- **NSAccessibilitySlider**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a slider.

## Groups

- **NSAccessibilityGroup**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to act as a container for other user interface elements.

## Lists

- **NSAccessibilityTable**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a table view.
- **NSAccessibilityList**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a list view.
- **NSAccessibilityOutline**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as an outline view.
- **NSAccessibilityRow**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a row for a table, list, or outline view.

## Text

- **NSAccessibilityStaticText**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as static text.
- **NSAccessibilityNavigableStaticText**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as navigable static text.

## Images and Color

- **NSAccessibilityImage**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as an image.
- **NSAccessibilityColor**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a color.

## Loading

- **NSAccessibilityProgressIndicator**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a progress indicator.
- **NSAccessibilityElementLoading**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to support loading.

## Dynamic Elements

- **NSAccessibilityContainsTransientUI**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to support dynamic UI changes.

## Layout Elements

- **NSAccessibilityLayoutArea**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a layout area.
- **NSAccessibilityLayoutItem**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a layout item.

## Supporting Types

- **NSAccessibilityElementProtocol**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.

## Custom View Subclasses

- **Accessibility Functions**: Global accessibility functions for custom views and controls.
